exercise.p: Compute the product 4m^2 n^3 \cdot 5 m^3 n using three different presentations as demonstrated in this section.

aside.p: The reason for doing this all three ways is to practice thinking through the logic. In the end, the goal will be that you can do this mentally, but you need to also be able to think through the individual steps correctly.

aside.p: Your final presentation for this will be 4(2x + 3) = (\text{Result}).

exercise.p: Calculate (x + 3)(x - 2) using a grid. Write up your result using a complete presentation, being sure to simplify by combining like terms.
Calculate 4a(-3a + 2) using a grid. Then write up your result as an equation.
Calculate (2x + 4)(x - 3) using a grid. Write up your result using a complete presentation, being sure to simplify by combining like terms.
Calculate (2a - 3b + 4)(a - 1) using a grid. Write up your result using a complete presentation, being sure to simplify by combining like terms.
Calculate (2x + 5)(3x - 1) using a grid. Write up your result using a complete presentation, being sure to simplify by combining like terms.
Calculate (x^2 - 2x + 3)(x - 4) using a grid. Write up your result using a complete presentation, being sure to simplify by combining like terms.

aside.p: We generally prefer that the terms of a polynomial are written so that the degree is decreasing. This helps everyone be consistent with each other.
